text:
Hey there, we don’t have a specific guide for Gitlab but we do have one for GitHub that you may be able to adapt to Gitlab equivalents.

First I recommend reading:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow|Creating an efficient development workflow>

Then
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/github-integration|Setting up continuous integration with a GitHub repository using GitHub Actions>
if you want to list it, then it will need to live outside of HubSpot
yep
use a lambda from AWS
its cheap and works

Hello, I have problems with my redirect domains, they worked well for more than a year and yesterday they stopped redirecting, they only left me at the beginning, has it happened to someone? What I can do?

Did you set it up in HubSpot or set it up at your DNS provider?

See the redirect note in this section if it was done through HubSpot:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/connect-a-domain-to-HubSpot#connect-your-domain>

Ensure in your domain settings that you see that redirect
Thanks all! Great input

Hey everyone. I'm trying to prove out an integration between Drupal 8 and HubSpot for a client. I have a test account and then created an App. I'm using the HubSpot Module in Drupal which requests the Portal ID (the ID to the test account), the sectret key, client key, and scopes (created in the app). I have all of this set up but when I click "Connect to HubSpot Account" through the Drupal module this redirects to HubSpot and has me select an account but then it just sits and spins. Is this due to the fact that that App isn't verified?
yes, i did review the dns and the redirect it's ok to my blog page but if i configure the other url in the URL Redirects panel isn't work

Hi everyone. When checking website assets urls, it's saying broken from domain url.
But the assets from CDN url are working.
How can I resolve this issue? Some assets like v2.js(for CTA and forms) is also from domain url and can't control this part. Please advise me. Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
To clarify I wasn’t saying using the URL redirects panel I was talking about adding the apex domain and setting it to redirect
DM me.

Hello, good people!
Has there recently (within the last few months) been any changes or fixes to HubSpot’s display charset? I used to have this problem where special (latin-extended) characters in the contact view, sent by our app’s `identify` call, would display as gibberish characters, but can’t seem to reproduce this now – just as I was going to ask about this in <#CBA9UA4EN|javascript>.

Using a repeatable field, why does the output get literally wrapped in brackets?

Hubl looks like either of these (same apparent result)
```                    <div class="list-title">{% inline_text field="text_group.repeatable_bullet_heading" value="{{ text_group.repeatable_bullet_heading }}" %}</div>
                    <div class="list-title">{{ text_group.repeatable_bullet_heading }}</div>````
what field type are you using for the repeater?
text
This happens to be in a drag and drop module btw
only output the value
```{{ text_group.repeatable_bullet_heading }}```

```{{ text_group.repeatable_bullet_heading }}```
Is that not what I have?
but. hmm. i see
is the text_group the repeater?
I
ah, rather than {{ }}
no
sorry
that is what it should be
more or less
{{ item.repeatable_bullet_heading }}
Oh I think
Ack. Some of these fields are themselves repeatable.
I probably need to nest the for loop
haha.. yeah that would do it
no.. make the group itself repeatable.
Duhr. Well sorry for the dumb question, but you've been invaluable.
The group itself is repeatable _and_ there are repeating field sinside
hmm. makes sense

So it'll be

for group
heading...
for copy
copy...
for bullet
bullet
Why isn't it a rich text you may ask? Because I don't have time to fix the styling of this crappy template :disappointed:
if you want all three in their own loop
make the group a repeater.
then have three non repeater fields in it
that way you get a title, body and bullet in every loop
It is that, too -- so you can have multiple headings. But I need to be able to have multiple bullet points in each section, and, I figure (because why not) multiple paragraphs of copy
so make the bullet a repeater too. and loop over that as well.
Yep!
within the other loop
oh.. yea, i didn't actually mean to make the heading a repeater.. :smile:
anyway, I think I can figure it out from here.. thanks so much for your help
yep
Also, the repeater field seems a little buggy.. True?
No bullet, yet bullet rendered.
I guess I can add a checkbox that says "render bullets" ...
Try module.text_group.repeatable_bullet
get rid of the > 0
is this what you are truing to do?
